content: Alongwith my three books "Aygyacha Mahamarg, Arogyacha Lochya and Vishwabandhutvacha Ashtang Yog, I recommend following books for Health, Welbeing, Peace and Harmony.
üìñ Love and Survival by Dr. Dean Ornish

This powerful book by renowned physician Dr. Dean Ornish explores the profound connection between emotional well-being and physical health. Drawing from scientific research, he shows how love, intimacy, and social support are as vital to survival as diet and exercise.
A must-read for anyone who wants to heal not just the body, but the heart and mind as well.
üìñ Trick and Treat by Barry Groves

In this thought-provoking book, Dr. Barry Groves challenges many modern health myths promoted by mainstream nutrition and medicine. Backed by decades of research, he argues that fat is not the enemy, and that many common health recommendations may actually harm more than help.
This book invites you to question conventional wisdom and take charge of your health with deeper understanding.
üìñ What Your Doctor Doesn’t Know About Nutritional Medicine May Be Killing You – Dr. Ray Strand

In this eye-opening book, Dr. Ray Strand shares his journey from a skeptical physician to a strong advocate of nutritional medicine. He explains how conventional medical training often overlooks the healing power of nutrients and antioxidants.
A compelling read that empowers you to make informed choices for prevention and long-term wellness beyond prescriptions.
üìñ Death by Prescription – Dr. Ray Strand

In *Death by Prescription*, Dr. Ray Strand exposes the often-overlooked risks of modern pharmaceuticals. Drawing from medical research and personal experience, he reveals how side effects, overprescribing, and lack of preventive focus can be harmful to long-term health.
This book encourages readers to take personal responsibility and explore safer, nutrition-based alternatives to healing.
